main event: Multiple sightings of a round silvery object over Columbus, Ohio, on June 25-26, 1954, reported by various observers including a transcontinental airliner crew.
interesting points: The object was described as a 'metallic blob' by an Army colonel,The crew of the airliner and 53 passengers witnessed the object from about 20,000 feet,The object was reportedly sighted by multiple observers including a charter flight captain and military personnel,The sightings were confirmed by reports from different entities including the Cincinnati ARTC,Observers reported the object moving at an altitude of approximately 13,000'-20,000' and had unclear data regarding its size or speed.
witness description: crew and passengers of a United Airlines flight and various military personnel
